page.title: 17LIVING IN SEDBERGH
page.content: Many people in this area do not want their communities and the landscape to change, they like things the way they are. For some, basic services such as water supplies, drainage and sanitation are very primitive but properties are expensive to purchase; Â£25,000 for a small terraced cottage in Sedbergh. Prices are inflated largely by the holiday homes market. Both locals and "off-comers" (new inhabitants) share a love of the wild countryside and the sense of peace and quiet. People are concerned about the problems of the world, such as the nuclear threat, but they feel a sense of being apart from the international crises they hear about on television and radio. This is why they like living here.
